title: Remember the plastic straw ban? : r/Somerville - Reddit
body: Business, Economics, and Finance. GameStop Moderna Pfizer Johnson & Johnson AstraZeneca Walgreens Best Buy Novavax SpaceX Tesla. Crypto
readable_content:
avidsdead (2019-12-08): Remember the plastic straw ban?
- cupacupacupacupacup (2019-12-08): On the other hand, nobody goes out and buys beverages any more.
- laughing-stockade (2019-12-08): Simpler times...
- blitstikler (2019-12-08): Why does the ban include biodegradable straws as well?
  - cocktailvirgin (2019-11-01): Assuming that you mean corn starch etc. ones and not paper: Because they're not much better than plastic unless they are separated from the waste stream and sent off for processing.
summary: The conversation reflects a mix of nostalgia for simpler times and some confusion about the ban on biodegradable straws. The sentiment seems somewhat nostalgic and questioning of the ban's scope. Overall, the tone is slightly critical of the ban. Sentiment: -0.4
